HTMLScriptElementNoModule.summary: The noModule property of the interface is a boolean value that indicates whether the script should be executed in browsers that support ES modules. Practically, this can be used to serve fallback scripts to older browsers that do not support JavaScript modules.

remarks.para: It reflects the nomodule attribute of the script element.

HTMLScriptElementNoModule.value: A boolean, true means that the script should not be executed in browsers that support ES modules, false otherwise.
